messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Chickenpox
messages.msgSnippet: I hate to add this to the conversation, but from what I have learned about this vaccination, it includes tissue from babies that have been aborted.  I would
messages.messageBody:
I hate to add this to the conversation, but from what I have learned about
this vaccination, it includes tissue from babies that have been aborted. I
would never give this to any child.

Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Chickenpox
messages.msgSnippet: mandatory  in Texas too for pupils born after a certain year.   Supposed to show either date of immunization or a documented history of having chickenpox
messages.messageBody:
"mandatory" in Texas too for pupils born after a certain year. Supposed to
show either date of immunization or a documented history of having chickenpox
(month, DAY, and year!).
vicki
----- Original Message -----
From: <brendaclaspell@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 07, 2001 9:11 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Chickenpox


> A mandatory chicken pox vaccination is completely bonkers!.
> I didn't know it was mandatory anywhere.

messages.subject: Chickenpox
messages.msgSnippet: A mandatory chicken pox vaccination is completely bonkers! My mother and her generation have loomed over me with the fears of polio... Have you ever seen a kid
messages.messageBody:
A mandatory chicken pox vaccination is completely bonkers! My mother and her
generation have loomed over me with the fears of polio..."Have you ever seen
a kid hooked up to an iron lung?!?!"
But chicken pox? The logic escapes me.
I live in Indiana and I've met a few people who've lived in Oregon who
consider it to be a very 'aware' place. I guess that awareness isn't in the
medical community.
I didn't know it was mandatory anywhere. That's really scary to me.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
